page.title: 09DUFTON VILLAGE INSTITUTE
page.content: This hall,given originally to the village by Lord Hothfield as a Conservative Club,is now more extensively used than for some time. There is no Church Hall,& since the school closed it has been the only available place for all village meetings,social events & polling station for elections.The Institute is regularly used by the Youth Club,the Badminton Club &the WI.Increased costs of heating,lighting & upkeep are a problem to be faced by a small committee.The Parish Council has given grants & Job Creation has helped with decorating,but improvements have been postponed because the floor of the main hall urgently needs renewing. All groups in the village who use the Hall are running extra fund-raising events to try & collect money for the floor. This is both fun & exhausting.
